About this website

Purpose

Ordisoftware™ was launched in 2008 by Olivier Rogier and its purpose is to provide services since 2004 in websites design and in software development.

Ordisoftware™ is an alias invented by the author using the french word Ordinateur and the english word Software. This name under which his professional activity is exercised since 2004 as a freelancer is not a company nor an organization.

The domains ordisoftware.com, ordisoftware.net, ordisoftware.org, ordisoftware.info, ordisoftware.biz, ordisoftware.eu and ordisoftware.fr are registered for this activity.

Archived on GitHub :

Specifications

Powered by WordPress and MySQL at Gandi.

Recommended minimum screen resolution:

  • Suitable for displays beyond 480×320 pixels.
  • Desktop computers, laptop and tablets : 1024x768 pixels.
  • Small tablets and smartphones: 640x480 pixels.
  • Browser's zoom function can be used with 4K screens.

Recognition of mobile devices is not currently guaranteed.

Privacy

Navigation

This site is accessible via the HTTPS protocol, which means that all the data exchanged between the Gandi Simple Hosting hosting server and your device is encrypted using the SSL protocol with 256-bits encryption and a certificate with a key of 2048-bits.

Cookies

The following information is stored in the cookies' space of your web browser: reading language and WordPress data.

This site does not collect any data for advertising purposes and no personal information other than those mentioned below.

Data collected by the website

In application of the GDPR, this site does not record your IP address beyond a certain period mentioned below.

The following information can be collected automatically and only for statistical purposes for a period not exceeding three months: country, city, type of operating system, screen resolution, browser name and pages displayed.

In order to guarantee advanced security of the site and your visit, the system may register your IP address in the web server database for a period not exceeding three months, unless blocked.

Your IP address may also be transmitted for verification to reputable third-party security services such as Shield Security, Zero Spam and IPStack, as well as Google Maps.

Information entered directly such as the name and the e-mail address are utilized exclusively in the scope of this website activity and they are not transferred to third parties.

Once received, e-mail messages are stored in an encrypted database with a strong password, and irrelevant ones are quickly deleted.

Data collection by downloadable software

The software available on this website doesn't collect any personal information about you, your computer and your network, unless it is specified by their features.

However, they can collect for debugging purposes the type of processor and operating system as well as errors caused by the code, but these information are only stored locally and only transmitted upon conscious validations by the user.

Access and modification rights

The processing of personal data is declared to the CNIL according to the Norme simplifiée N°48 under reference 1264692 on November 26, 2007.

According to the French computer and liberty law of January 6, 1978, you have a right to access, modify and delete your data.

Copyright

Photos and images

Banner images of Home, Music and Legal pages are under commercial copyright of Shutterstock and Fotolia for contact. Four important mathematical formulas relating to the physical universe have been added to the first.

Photos between the top menu and pages content come from GnomeArt and are published under Creative Commons BY or BY-SA and Free Art License licenses.

Drawings and diagrams within texts of the description of the services come from or were realized with Microsoft Word and can be subject to terms of use.

Documents and brochures

Downloadable documents such as information brochures are distributed according to their own license indicated by their content, the legal standard copyright is appliquable by default.

Software and source code

Software and source code published on this website are licensed under their own license.

Editorial content and diagrams

Texts and schemas are registered at Copyright Depot and are protected by intellectual property rights under the Creative Commons BY-NC-ND 4.0 International license - attribution of the work to the author, no commercial use and no derivative works made by the user - unless otherwise specified.

External resources

Links to external resources and websites are listed for informational purposes and they do not engage any responsibility.
